results.title: Feeling the felt
results.brief_description: Sometimes we discover new stories about our family members. This story reveals to us the layers of family history we don’t always see.

results.title: Love your Work
results.brief_description: When my son turned 15 I began to reflect on my Father’s life and his father before him. This story spans across continents and four generations of men.

results.title: Gary's story
results.creator_credit: Richard Michalak, Ray Argall, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Gary is between girlfriends. When he meets Sally in the supermarket he discovers that she is between boyfriends so he asks her out.
“What about a cup of coffee?”
“I don’t drink coffee.”
“Tea, then?”
“I don’t believe in stimulants.”
“Milk?”
“Creates mucus.”
From this high point their relationship deteriorates. But Gary’s story has a happy ending – eventually.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Michalak, Ray Argall, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS

results.title: Sorry
results.brief_description: 75 years later, the survivors and their descendants of the Coniston massacre invited my family to remember the past. I went to say sorry. I was the only member of my family to attend.

results.title: Freely given
results.brief_description: “This instrument may be freely given, never bought or sold” says violin maker John Godschall Johnson as we see him carving and shaping a beautifully handcrafted violin into its final form.

results.title: Billie in Oakleigh
results.brief_description:
A short home-movie shot in slow-motion of the graceful and elegant movements of Billie O’Keefe as she performs a gymnastic routine in the urban landscape of Oxford Street, Oakleigh.
This poetic film is backed by the haunting soundtrack of celtic music played by Cath Connelly (harp) and Greg Hunt (fiddle).

results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description: A young girl is given a video recorder as a gift. Structured as a video and super-8 diary, this compelling short film investigates the devastating effects on a child of adult secrets. This exceptional Australian short film is a first person narrative conveyed completely through point of view and mise-en-scene. Cast features Steve Jacobs and Lynette Curran.

results.title: Far away castle: music video by Sunwrae
results.creator_credit: Colin Chee and Multimedia Design, Faculty of Design, Swinburne University of Technology
results.brief_description:
A beautiful aesthetic piece of instrumental contemporary classical music, in rondo form (repetition of a single theme) with various tempi and expressions (music cycle). Colin Chee uses animation to portray music as both a life force and an escape from reality. Ethereal in style, movement and sound.
Music composed by Rae Howell or Sunwrae.

results.title: Artist: unknown
results.brief_description:
Being a struggling artist is tough at the best of times but when you’re thousands of miles from home, your debts are mounting and you’re making no money, something’s got to give.
Amy made the long trip from Australia to London to paint. The rent on her workspace is now a month overdue, the landlord is knocking and working part-time in a cafe is not making ends meet. She could try selling her work - but that would entail showing people.
Shot on location in London with original music by Horse Stories. Produced, directed and written by Catherine Green.
